page.title: 04HATHERDEN HOUSE FARM.
page.content: The Capes family have lived at Hatherden House for over forty years and they farm 1,250 acres.Two thirds of this is cereal crop, 300 acres are grass and the rest is given over to dairy cows and peas.There are 6 people who work for them altogether three of these are tractor drivers.They start work at 8am and they stop work at 12pm for dinner then they go back to work at 1pm and go on till 5pm.They work 5 days a week.They have 6 Ford tractors and 1 David Brown tractor and they have 2 combines which are yellow and 1 baler which is red.They have 180 dairy cows and young stock and 16 horses,some which are used by riding for the disabled.Mr.and Mrs Capes don't want Andover to spread this far and they want more time to meet people in the villages and they hope no oil is found as a result of the survey.
